de.polygonal.ds.HashMap<K, T>

type
class
implements
Map<K, T>

A hash using flash.utils.Dictionary.

  • Each key can only map a single value.
  • null keys and null values are not allowed.

Constructor

new(?weak : Bool, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
weak if true, weak keys are used. A key/value pair is lost when no other object besides this object holds a reference to the key. Default is false.
maxSize the maximum allowed size of the stack. The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this hash map.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

Instance Methods

inline clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, elements are nullified upon removal.
Removes all key/value pairs.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, element.clone() is used for duplicating elements.
In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier uses a custom function instead of element.clone() for copying elements if the assign parameter is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this hash map either by creating a shallow or deep copy.

inline clr(key : K) : Bool

returns
true if key is successfully removed, false if key does not exist.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key is null (debug only).
Removes key and the value that is mapped to it.

inline contains(x : T) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null (debug only).
Same as has().

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).

inline get(key : K) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key is null (debug only).
Returns the value that is mapped to key or null if key does not exist.

inline has(val : T) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError val is null (debug only).
Returns true if this map contains a mapping for val.

inline hasKey(key : K) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key is null (debug only).
Returns true if this map contains the key key.

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this hash map is empty.

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new HashMapValIterator object to iterate over all values contained in this hash map.
The values are visited in a random order.

keys() : Itr<K>

Iterates over all keys.

inline remap(key : K, val : T) : Bool

returns
true if key was successfully remapped to val.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key/val is null (debug only).
Remaps an existing key to a new val.

inline remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
false if x does not exist.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null (debug only).
Removes the value x.

inline set(key : K, val : T) : Bool

returns
true if key was added, false if key already exists.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError key/val is null (debug only).
Maps val to key.

inline size() : Int

The total number of key/value pairs.

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an unordered array containing all values in this hash map.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns an unordered dense array containing all values in this hash map.

toKeyArray() : Array<K>

Returns an array of all keys.

toKeyDA() : DA<K>

Returns a dense array of all keys.

toKeySet() : Set<K>

Returns a set view of the keys contained in this map.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug directive.
Example:

	  var hm = new de.polygonal.ds.HashMap<String, String>();
	  hm.set("key1", "val1");
	  hm.set("key2", "val2");
	  trace(hm);
	  {HashMap, size: 2}
	  |<
	    key1 -> val1
	    key2 -> val2
	  >|

toValSet() : Set<T>

Returns a set view of the mappings contained in this map.
